intro: Iochroma ortizianthum, commonly known as the orange tree of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers, which are usually orange or yellow, bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
